subject: Re: Swingui TestRunner
msgSnippet: You are right, the excluded.prop did not come into play as yet. But I don t know how to make that. This is what I have done. First I created a dir under c:
messageBody:
You are right, the excluded.prop did not come into play as yet.
But I don't know how to make that.

This is what I have done.
First I created a dir under c:\ called XYZ. under that I have created
junit/runner. In this dir I put the excluded.properties.
I added c:\XYZ to my classpath.
and then I added the junit.jar
It still did not work.

So then I decided to replace the excluded.prop in the jar with a new
one, so I extracted the whole junit.jar, but could not find the
excluded.prop file anywhere

What am I doing wrong?




--- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
> parul_49 wrote:
>
> >I have another question,
> >I read on the FAQ's site for Junit, saying that if you get a
linkage
> >error, change the excluded.properties file, to include other
> >packages, and place that in ur classpath before the junit.jar.
> >
>
> Yes, in the same package structure as it is in the junit.jar file,
> specifically:
>
> /junit/runner/excluded.properties
>
>
> >
> >What I have done is that I modified the excluded.properties and
> >added/replaced it in the junit.jar and mounted it.
> >Is that the same thing, or will it not work?
> >
>
> If by "mounted" you mean added it to the classpath used by NetBeans
or
> whatever, then I suppose so.
>
> >
> >I tried using the swingui, but it gives me all kinds of
exceptions. I
> >know my tests run thru' the textui, but it gives a
classCastException
> >and a null ptr exception.
> >would anyone know why?
> >
>
> I suspect your changed excluded.properties file isn't in play.
Perhaps
> it's not in the correct package.
>
> >
> >Also I am using net Beans, so when u say that put it in your
> >classpath before the junit.jar does that mean mount it before you
> >mount the junit.jar.
> >
>
> It means the classpath order defines your fully-qualified
> excluded.properties file before the default one. If "mounting"
gets you
> there, then so be it.
>
> Mike
